template_data.gwin|HAR|wif|refs: she was considered a princess among the [[tulani]] nobles acting as an example of how righteous anger can be tempered with goodness. Her endless crusade against evil served as an inspiration for all eladrin peoples.

document_data.caption: Gwynharwyf, the Whirling Fury
document_data.name: Gwynharwyf
document_data.race: [[Bralani]]<ref group="note">The [[Blood Wars]] collectible card game describes her as a [[tulani]] princess.
document_data.text: ...her lover [[Morwel]] keeps her on a short leash in matters relating to [[Demogorgon]]. There was, shall we say, an incident several centuries ago.
document_data.source: The Witch Queen [[Iggwilv]], regarding Gwynharwyf{{Cite dungeon/149/Enemies of My Enemy|50}}
document_data.mainbody: [[Demogorgon]] once allied with [[Ilsidahur]] of the [[barlgura]]s to re-open the [[portal]] known as the [[Shining Vortex of Mesnar]] from the Abyssal forest of [[Morathkian]] to [[Arborea]]. Through it, the two [[demon lord]]s led an army in revenge against the eladrin's ancient invasion of the Abyss. Gwynharwyf's armies pushed the fiendish forces back to the Abyss, but in order to seal the portal, she had to sacrifice herself and remained trapped there.{{Cite dragon/357/Demonomicon of Iggwilv: Demogorgon: Prince of Demons|25}} Gwynharwyf was taken prisoner, but the two demon lords could not agree on the best way to torture and kill the bralani princess, and Morwel came with a force of her own to free her cherished consort from their grasp. Ilsidahur lost his right hand during the rescue.
document_data.Description: Gwynharwyf appeared [[elf]]-like with wild, silver-white hair, tanned skin, and eyes the color of [[jade]]. She was somewhat short and stocky as were most bralani.
document_data.Abilities:
Gwynharwyf was a barbarian warrior unrivaled in her ferocity in battle. She never tired, even after exerting herself in a fit of rage, and no one could succeed in flanking her. She had an uncanny ability to dodge dangers before most would even be able to sense them. 

As a bralani eladrin, Gwynharwyf could take the form of a whirlwind of sparkling, stinging sand. She had all the inherent magical powers of her kind, including the ability to see in [[Darkvision|darkness]] and [[Low-light vision|low light]], strong resistance to magic spells, several immunities, and many [[spell]]-like powers. She could only be harmed by the most powerful of mundane weapons, but she could be injured by [[cold iron]] or weapons wielded by truly evil beings. Additionally, Gwynharwyf's beautiful voice had all the powers of [[bard]]ic magic.

She was at all times surrounded by a magical aura of goodness and light that [[Magic circle against evil|resisted evil]] and [[Lesser globe of invulnerability|protected against weaker magical spells and effects]].

Gwynharwyf could magically speak and understand any [[Tongues|tongue]].
document_data.Possessions:
[[File:GwynharwyfB.jpg|thumb|right|250px|''Gwynharwyf approaching with blades drawn.'']]
Gwynharwyf fought with a pair of [[scimitar]]s that gleamed with every color of the rainbow. One of these holy blades could [[Banishment|banish]] enemies that it injured.
document_data.Activities:
When not attending to Queen Morwel's needs, Gwynharwyf was found leading armies of champions into battle against [[fiend]]ish forces.

Gwynharwyf did not make a permanent abode but could be found wandering the elven realm of [[Arvandor]] or the [[Gates of the Moon]].
document_data.Relationships:
Queen Morwel showed great affection for Gwynharwyf and relied heavily on her advice. Gwynharwyf herself was served by a bralani champion named Sirocco, who was charming and mischievous in his behavior but fully loyal to her.

The [[demon lord]] [[Graz'zt]] considered Gwynharwyf to be one of his greatest enemies.{{Cite dungeon/149/Enemies of My Enemy|42}} [[Kostchtchie]] hated her so much that when his cult captured women to use as sacrificial victims; they dyed their hair silver, dressed them like Gwynharwyf, and strapped scimitars to their hands before slaughtering them.{{Cite dragon/345/Demonomicon of Iggwilv: Kostchtchie: Prince of Wrath|26}}
